result.execSummary:
The defendant Rafael Carranza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence, with credit for 4 days (12-17-2014 TO 12-20-2014) time served.
Probation conditions apply except for 1 year condition time.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison.

miscConds.notes:
Fine is set at ZERO.
Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both.

No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present.

No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time. 
Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- No contact with Nestor G. (DOB 08-26-1991).
- No contact with 11113 W. Wildwood Lane, Oak Creek, WI

Defendant to participate in a Cognitive Behavior program or cognitive intervention program.
Drivers license suspension is not imposed.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.

timeConds.notes: Court ordered defendant to serve 1 YEAR CONDITION TIME in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release ONLY for The Day Reporting Center, work, and inmate work assignments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. FORTHWITH.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rafael Carranza

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rafael Carranza in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Danielle Chojnacki on behalf of Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1 -
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS 6 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days (12-17-2014 TO 12-20-2014) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 24 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 30 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present.  
- Maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- No contact with Nestor G. (DOB 08-26-1991).
- No contact with 11113 W. Wildwood Lane, Oak Creek, WI
- Defendant to participate in a Cognitive Behavior program or cognitive intervention program.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
- Court ordered defendant to serve 1 YEAR CONDITION TIME in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release ONLY for The Day Reporting Center, work, and inmate work assignments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. FORTHWITH

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Rafael Carranza in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Danielle Chojnacki on behalf of Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
AS TO COUNT 1 :

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, any victims and the defendant.   Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. 

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing, 10-13-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rafael Carranza in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Defense counsel in jury trial on another matter in another court. Case adjourned for projected plea and sentencing on 08-27-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17. Parties notified that effective August 1, 2015, Branch 17 will be located in the Safety Building, room 310.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rafael Carranza in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Danielle Chojnacki for Dennis Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty, and requests plea date and sentencing date. Defense has received discovery and an offer. Court ordered that any motions be filed by the next court date. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Fiorenza.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Stark, Branch 17.

Information NOT filed.  Court orders case adjourned for arraignment and scheduling conference in Branch 17.

Defendant Rafael Carranza in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Marissa Santiago, appearing for Dennis Patrick Murphy, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.

No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription or drug paraphenilia  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 06-05-2015 at 01:30 pm.
